high-pressure.translation[0].definitions: a high-pressure job or situation is one in which you need to work very hard
containing or using a very high pressure or force of water, gas, air etc
high-pressure.translation[1].definitions: a high-pressure job or situation is one where you need to work extremely hard
He helped launch the television network and then left the high-pressure job after disagreements with a colleague.
very direct methods of selling that try to force people to buy
They used high pressure sales tactics to force unwary customers to buy securities that were worthless.
